    "patch": "@@ -166,7 +166,7 @@ The `error` field has several possible values - review the protocol documentatio\n | AADSTS50117 | Failed to deserialize policy specified in the request's claim parameter. |\n | AADSTS50120 | Unknown credential type, issue with the JWT header. Contact the tenant admin. |\n | AADSTS50123 | Unknown claims transformation method '{method}' was specified for principal '{principalId}'. |\n-| AADSTS50124 | Invalid regular expression configured for claims transformation for this application. Contact your tenant admin to fix the claims mapping configuration. See [Customize SAML token claims](/identity/saml-claims-customization) |\n+| AADSTS50124 | Invalid regular expression configured for claims transformation for this application. Contact your tenant admin to fix the claims mapping configuration. See [Customize SAML token claims](saml-claims-customization.md) |\n | AADSTS501241 | Mandatory Input '{paramName}' missing from transformation ID '{transformId}'. This error is returned while Microsoft Entra ID is trying to build a SAML response to the application. NameID claim or NameIdentifier is mandatory in SAML response and if Microsoft Entra ID failed to get source attribute for NameID claim, it returns this error. As a resolution, ensure that you add claim rules. To add claim rules, sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Cloud Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#cloud-application-administrator), and then browse to **Entra ID** > **Enterprise apps**. Select your application, select **Single Sign-On** and then in **User Attributes & Claims** enter the Unique User Identifier (Name ID). |\n | AADSTS50125 | PasswordResetRegistrationRequiredInterrupt - Sign-in was interrupted because of a password reset or password registration entry. |\n | AADSTS50126 | InvalidUserNameOrPassword - Error validating credentials due to invalid username or password. The user didn't enter the right credentials. Expect to see some number of these errors in your logs due to users making mistakes. |\n@@ -215,7 +215,7 @@ The `error` field has several possible values - review the protocol documentatio\n | AADSTS50170 | MissingExternalClaimsProviderMapping - The external controls mapping is missing. |\n | AADSTS50171 | The given audience can only be used in Mutual-TLS token calls. |\n | AADSTS50172 | External claims provider {provider} isn't approved. |\n-| AADSTS50173 | The provided grant has expired due to it being revoked, a fresh auth token is needed. To learn more, see the troubleshooting article for error [AADSTS50173](/troubleshoot/entra/app-integration/error-code-aadsts50173-grant-expired-revoked). |\n+| AADSTS50173 | The provided grant has expired due to it being revoked, a fresh auth token is needed. Error: {errorInfo}. |\n | AADSTS501621 | ClaimsTransformationTimeoutRegularExpressionTimeout - Regular expression replacement for claims transformation has timed out. This indicates a too complex regular expression may have been configured for this application. A retry of the request may succeed. Otherwise, please contact your admin to fix the configuration. |\n | AADSTS530032 | BlockedByConditionalAccessOnSecurityPolicy - The tenant admin has configured a security policy that blocks this request. Check the security policies that are defined on the tenant level to determine if your request meets the policy requirements. |\n | AADSTS700016 | UnauthorizedClient_DoesNotMatchRequest - The application wasn't found in the directory/tenant. This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported.  For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n+- An on-premises server for the provisioning agent that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported.  For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n \n   - Required for AD Schema attribute  - msDS-ExternalDirectoryObjectId\n     \n@@ -43,7 +43,7 @@ We recommend that you harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server to d\n - Ensure every machine has a unique local administrator password. For more information, see [Local Administrator Password Solution (Windows LAPS)](/windows-server/identity/laps/laps-overview) can configure unique random passwords on each workstation and server store them in Active Directory protected by an ACL. Only eligible authorized users can read or request the reset of these local administrator account passwords. Additional guidance for operating an environment with Windows LAPS and privileged access workstations (PAWs) can be found in [Operational standards based on clean source principle](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model#operational-standards-based-on-clean-source-principle). \n - Implement dedicated [privileged access workstations](https://4sysops.com/archives/understand-the-microsoft-privileged-access-workstation-paw-security-model/) for all personnel with privileged access to your organization's information systems. \n - Follow these [additional guidelines](/windows-server/identity/ad-ds/plan/security-best-practices/reducing-the-active-directory-attack-surface) to reduce the attack surface of your Active Directory environment.\n-- Follow the [Monitor changes to federation configuration](../connect/how-to-connect-monitor-federation-changes.md) to set up alerts to monitor changes to the trust established between your Idp and Microsoft Entra ID. \n+- Follow the [Monitor changes to federation configuration](../connect/how-to-connect-monitor-federation-changes.md) to set up alerts to monitor changes to the trust established between your IdP and Microsoft Entra ID. \n - Enable multifactor authentication (MFA) for all users that have privileged access in Microsoft Entra ID or in AD. One security issue with using Microsoft Entra provisioning agent is that if an attacker can get control over the Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server they can manipulate users in Microsoft Entra ID. To prevent an attacker from using these capabilities to take over Microsoft Entra accounts, MFA offers protections. If there's a firewall between your servers and Microsoft Entra ID, see [Firewall and proxy requirements](#firewall-and-proxy-requirements).\n "

ai_summary.Response:
This commit updates several documentation files related to Microsoft Entra ID. Key changes include:

*   **Error Code Documentation:** The `docs/identity-platform/reference-error-codes.md` file has been updated to correct a link in the AADSTS50124 error description and to add new error codes AADSTS240003 and AADSTS240004.
*   **Server Version Requirements:** Multiple files within the `docs/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync` and `docs/identity/hybrid/connect` directories have been updated to reflect a preference for Windows Server 2022, 2019, or 2016, shifting away from solely referencing Windows Server 2016 as the minimum. This includes updates to prerequisites for Microsoft Entra Connect, cloud sync agents, and provisioning agents.
*   **Date Updates:** Several `ms.date` metadata fields have been advanced to later dates, suggesting ongoing content reviews and updates.

ai_summary.Response: The provided commit history indicates updates across several Microsoft Entra ID documentation pages, primarily concerning hybrid identity solutions. The changes focus on clarifying and standardising the supported Windows Server versions for agent installations and related prerequisites. Specifically, Windows Server 2022, 2019, and 2016 are now consistently listed as the recommended or supported operating systems for various hybrid identity components, including cloud sync agents and Microsoft Entra Connect installations. Additionally, some documentation dates have been updated to reflect the latest publication or review.
